about.title: About the Faculty
about.subtitle: Leading the future of artificial intelligence education in Egypt
about.description1: Faculty of Artificial Intelligence at Menoufia University is a specialized institution committed to preparing students for the future of technology. Established in line with Egypt's Vision 2030, the college equips students with the skills needed to lead in AI, machine learning, and intelligent systems.
about.description2: Our faculty combines theoretical knowledge with practical application, ensuring graduates are ready to tackle real-world challenges in the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence.
about.visionText: To produce future-ready innovators capable of building intelligent systems that benefit industries and societies, positioning Egypt as a leader in AI education and research in the Middle East and Africa.
about.missionText: To educate AI professionals through advanced programs, applied training, and world-class research aligned with sustainable development goals, fostering innovation and ethical AI practices.
about.industryFocusedDesc: Curriculum designed with industry partners to meet real market needs.
about.researchExcellenceDesc: Cutting-edge research opportunities with renowned faculty members.
about.globalStandardsDesc: International curriculum standards with English as the primary language.

dataScience.title: Data Science
dataScience.description: Master the art of extracting insights from complex datasets using advanced analytics and machine learning.

machineIntelligence.title: Machine Intelligence
machineIntelligence.description: Develop intelligent systems that can learn, adapt, and make decisions autonomously.

cybersecurity.title: Cybersecurity
cybersecurity.description: Protect digital assets and infrastructure using AI-powered security solutions.

intelligentSystems.title: Intelligent Systems
intelligentSystems.description: Design and build smart systems that integrate AI into real-world applications.

howToUse.title: How to Use the Chatbot
content: Type your question in Arabic or English
Use the suggested prompts to explore common topics
You can ask follow-up questions - the chatbot remembers context

betterAnswers.title: Tips for Better Answers
content: Be specific: Try "What are the admission requirements for cybersecurity?"
If the answer is unclear, rephrase your question
Use keywords related to your topic
Ask one question at a time for clearer responses

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find quick answers to common questions about our faculty
faq.stillHaveQuestionsDesc: Can't find what you're looking for? Try our AI chatbot or contact us directly.
faq.noResultsDesc: Try different keywords or browse all categories above

questions.question: What qualifications do I need to join the college?
questions.answer: You need a high school certificate with a science or math track. International students must pass a math qualifier. The minimum grade requirements vary each year based on competition and available seats.

questions.question: When does the admission process start?
questions.answer: Admission typically opens in July each year. Check our website regularly for exact dates and application deadlines.

questions.question: Are there entrance exams?
questions.answer: Yes, there may be aptitude tests for certain programs. International students must pass a mathematics qualifier exam.

questions.question: What majors are available?
questions.answer: We offer four main specializations: Data Science, Machine Intelligence, Cybersecurity, and Intelligent Systems. Each program is designed to prepare you for the future of AI technology.

questions.question: Can I change my major?
questions.answer: Yes, you can change your major within the first two semesters, subject to academic performance and availability in the desired program.

questions.question: What is the curriculum structure?
questions.answer: The curriculum includes core AI courses, specialization courses, electives, practical training, and a graduation project. All courses are taught in English.

questions.question: How many credit hours are required to graduate?
questions.answer: 146 credit hours over 4 academic years (8 semesters). This includes core courses, electives, field training, and your graduation project.

questions.question: What is the minimum credit hours per semester?
questions.answer: Students must register for a minimum of 12 credit hours per semester and a maximum of 21 credit hours.

questions.question: How are credit hours calculated?
questions.answer: Each course has a specific credit hour value based on contact hours and workload. Theoretical courses are typically 3 credits, while practical courses may be 1-2 credits.

questions.question: Is there a graduation project?
questions.answer: Yes, it's a 6-credit project over the final year. You'll work on a real-world AI problem under faculty supervision. Field training is also mandatory.

questions.question: How does field training work?
questions.answer: Field training is a mandatory 6-credit internship in your final year. Students work with industry partners or research institutions for practical experience.

questions.question: Can I do my project with external companies?
questions.answer: Yes, we encourage industry collaboration. Projects can be done with approved companies under faculty supervision.

questions.question: What happens if I fail a course?
questions.answer: You can retake failed courses. The new grade replaces the old one in GPA calculation. However, both attempts appear on your transcript.

questions.question: Is there a dean's list?
questions.answer: Yes, students with GPA 3.5 or higher and no failing grades are eligible for the dean's list each semester.

questions.question: Is the study in English?
questions.answer: Yes, English is the primary language of instruction for all courses, ensuring graduates are prepared for the global job market.

questions.question: Are there scholarships available?
questions.answer: Yes, merit-based scholarships are available for outstanding students. Financial aid may also be available for students in need.

questions.question: What career opportunities are available?
questions.answer: Graduates can work as AI engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity specialists, research scientists, or pursue advanced degrees in AI and related fields.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Please read these terms and conditions carefully before using our service
terms.introduction: Welcome to the AI Academic Advisor platform. By accessing or using our chatbot services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.

useOfService.title: Use of Service
useOfService.content: You agree to use the service only for lawful academic support. You must not misuse or exploit the chatbot for unethical or harmful purposes.

accountResponsibility.title: Account Responsibility
accountResponsibility.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and any activity under your account.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: All content, code, and services provided through this app are owned by the project creators and protected under copyright laws.

limitationOfLiability.title: Limitation of Liability
limitationOfLiability.content: The chatbot provides academic guidance based on pre-trained data and logic. We are not liable for decisions made based on chatbot responses.

changesToTerms.title: Changes to Terms
changesToTerms.content: We may update these Terms at any time. Continued use of the platform indicates acceptance of the updated Terms.

terms.questionsDesc: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Your privacy is important to us. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your information.
privacy.introduction: This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your personal information when you use the AI Academic Advisor chatbot.

informationWeCollect.title: Information We Collect
informationWeCollect.content: We collect basic account information such as email and password for authentication purposes via Supabase. We also store your chat history tied to your user account.

howWeUseInfo.title: How We Use Your Information
howWeUseInfo.content: Your information is used solely to provide academic assistance and save your chat history. We do not share your data with third parties.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We use Supabase to store user data securely with authentication and database rules that prevent unauthorized access.

userControl.title: User Control
userControl.content: You may delete your account and associated chat history at any time. Please contact support if you need help with account deletion.

updatesToPolicy.title: Updates to This Policy
updatesToPolicy.content: We may revise this Privacy Policy as the platform evolves. Updates will be posted on this page.

privacy.questionsDesc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.
